title: Citi Announces Winners of the 2013 Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards in South Africa
summary: Johannesburg - Citi South Africa has announced the winners of the 2013 Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards Program. Five local entrepreneurs were awarded and will share the prize money of R110,000.
tag-1: Citi Announces Winners of the 2013 Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards in South Africa
tag-2: Johannesburg – Citi South Africa has announced the winners of the 2013 Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards Program. Five local entrepreneurs were awarded and will share the prize money of R110,000.
tag-3: Many business leaders as well as South Africa's top female entrepreneur of the year, Margaret Hirsch, attended the event, which was acknowledged as an informative and entertaining evening.
tag-4: The shortlisted candidates were flown to Johannesburg where they attended a training session in the morning followed by the gala event in the afternoon. Speakers on the night included two remarkable female entrepreneurs who succeeded in the industry and shared their stories.
tag-5: The Citi Micro-Entrepreneurship Awards Program is an annual initiative designed to promote and reward micro-entrepreneurs who are making a meaningful difference in their communities. These awards are held in 27 countries across the world. In total the winners will receive R110,000 to assist them boost their respective businesses.
tag-6: "Micro-entrepreneurs contribute significantly to South Africa's GDP and assist in alleviating poverty and unemployment in the communities they operate in. Big businesses need to assist in ensuring the growth and sustainability of the small business as without them, the unemployment rate in South Africa would be much higher," said Donna Oosthuyse, Managing Director and Citi Country Officer for South Africa.
tag-7: "SMEs [small and medium-sized enterprises] have been identified globally as the key drivers of creating wealth, reducing poverty and facilitating jobs. In South Africa, it is reported that SMEs contribute 40 percent of GDP and 60 percent of the workforce in formal employment and we are pleased that Citi South Africa is assisting these SMEs grow and develop their businesses further," said Colleen Larsen, CEO of Business Engage.
